discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A security group in AWS controls the inbound and outbound traffic for an EC2 instance. It acts as a firewall, allowing or denying specific traffic based on predefined rules. You can specify which IP addresses, ports, and protocols can communicate with the instance

questions.question_text: Which of the following offers the ability to manage access at the cloud VM instance?
In an environment with one router, which of the following will allow a network engineer to communicate between VLANs without purchasing additional hardware?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A subinterface is a logical division of a physical router interface, allowing each subinterface to be assigned to a different VLAN. This effectively creates multiple virtual interfaces on a single physical port, enabling routing between different VLANs using a single router

questions.question_text: A network administrator is concerned with on-path attacks and wants to provide encryption of fully qualified domain names in outbound communications. Which of the following best describes the protocol that provides the proper security layer for internet communication?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
DoH encrypts DNS queries by sending them over HTTPS (port 443), hiding the FQDNs and other DNS data from on-path observers. This prevents attackers from intercepting or manipulating DNS requests, making it an ideal solution for the network administratorâ€™s concern about on-path attacks targeting domain name resolution.

Selected Answer: A
An Access Control List (ACL) on a firewall is specifically designed to control network traffic based on defined rules. A firewall administrator can create an ACL rule that allows only inbound connections on TCP port 443 (the port for HTTPS) to the company website's IP address. Any other incoming traffic attempting to reach the website on different ports or from unauthorized IP addresses would be blocked by the ACL

choices.C: Content filtering on a web gateway
choices.B: Port security on an access switch
choices.D: URL filtering on an outbound proxy

questions.question_text: A network administrator wants to restrict inbound traffic to allow only HTTPS to the company website, denying all other inbound traffic from the internet. Which of the following would best accomplish this goal?

A network engineer is deploying switches at a new remote office. The switches have been preconfigured with hostnames and STP priority values.

Based on the following table:

//IMG//


Which of the following switches will become the root bridge?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
access-sw01
If two switches have the same priority value, the switch with the lowest MAC address will be selected as the root bridge. Here both core-sw01 and access-sw01 has same STP priority values. access-sw01 has lowest MAC address.

Selected Answer: B
The switch with the lowest Bridge ID becomes the Root Bridge.
The Bridge ID = Bridge Priority + MAC Address. In this case core-sw01 and access-sw01 tie with 4096 but the lower MAC address is the tie breaker e<f
